In a Residence BB District, no building or premises
shall be used and no building shall be erected or altered for other
than one or more of the following specified uses:
Any use permitted in a Residence B District.

Multifamily dwellings, when approved by the Board
of Trustees of the Village of Farmingdale as a special use permit
after a public hearing.[Amended 4-22-1963]

Nursing home or convalescent home, provided that the
site has a minimum of 1/2 acre and a minimum frontage of 100 feet
at the building line and a minimum of 100 feet at the rear building
line.[Added 3-25-1991 by L.L. No. 5-1991]

The building area shall not exceed 35% of the
lot area.

There shall be a required front yard which shall
be not less than 25 feet in depth, except that where a multifamily
dwelling is erected or an existing building is converted to a multifamily
dwelling, the required front yard shall not be less than 35 feet in
depth.

There shall be two side yards, one on each side
of the main building. Each side yard shall not be less than six feet
wide, except that where a multifamily dwelling is erected or an existing
building is converted to a multiple dwelling, each side yard shall
not be less than 30 feet.

There shall be a required rear yard which shall
have a minimum depth of 35 feet.

No building shall be erected upon a lot that has a street frontage and minimum lot width at the front and rear wall of the principal building of less than 50 feet and a lot area of less than 5,000 square feet, except that where a multifamily dwelling is to be erected or an existing building is to be converted to a multifamily dwelling, the provisions of Article IV of this chapter shall apply.

No building shall be greater than 2 1/2 stories or 35 feet in height, except that no multifamily dwelling hereafter erected or any building hereafter converted to a multifamily dwelling shall be higher than that which is permitted pursuant to the provisions of Article IV of this chapter.
